replies.context:
You seem to have forgotten that Poland, under the dictator Pilsudski, seized territory from Germany, Lithuania, Belarus, Ukraine, and Slovakia after WW-1.  Later, the Polish dictator Jozef Beck refused to allow the German city of Danzig to return to Germany.  Beck put is faith in his military alliance with the mighty French Empire.
The Molotov-Ribbentrop Pact was proposed by Stalin, the communist dictator of the USSR.  Hitler hoped that the pact would prevent a war with Britain and France, if he went to war with Poland over Danzig.   Stalin hoped that the pact would encourage Hitler to attack Poland, resulting in a war between the capitalist powers of Germany, France, Britain, and Italy.
Hitler launched his attack on Poland (joined by Slovakia) on Sept 1, 1939.  Britain and France declared war on Germany on Sept 3, 1939, thus starting WW-II in Europe.  However, Britain and France did nothing to help the dictator Beck and Poland.  Stalin saw this, and launched his own invasion of Poland on Sept 17, 1939.  Britain and France did not declare war on the USSR!
